panels.description: Number of times the maximum number of child processes was reached. When this counter increases, it indicates your PHP-FPM pool is hitting capacity limits and requests may be queued or rejected.
panels.title: Max Children Reached

panels.description: Number of failed attempts to scrape PHP-FPM status. High values indicate connectivity issues between the monitoring system and PHP-FPM, potentially due to network problems or PHP-FPM being overloaded.
panels.title: Scrape Failures

panels.description: Number of requests that exceeded the configured slow request threshold. High values indicate performance issues with PHP application code or database queries that need optimization.
panels.title: Slow Requests

panels.description: Percentage of active processes compared to total available processes. High utilization (>80%) indicates the pool is approaching capacity and may need scaling. Low utilization might indicate over-provisioning.
panels.title: Process Utilization

panels.description: Time since PHP-FPM pool was started. Frequent restarts may indicate instability or configuration issues. Long uptimes show pool stability.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Number of requests waiting in the listen queue. High queue depth indicates incoming requests are arriving faster than they can be processed, leading to increased response times.
panels.title: Queue Depth

panels.description: Rate of accepted connections per second over a 5-minute window. Shows the incoming request load and helps identify traffic patterns and peak usage times.
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description: Average and maximum request processing time in microseconds. High durations indicate slow application code, database queries, or external API calls that need optimization.
panels.title: Request Duration

panels.description: Number of active (processing requests) and idle (waiting for requests) processes over time. Stacked view shows total process allocation and utilization patterns.
panels.title: Process States

panels.description: Average and maximum memory consumption per request in bytes. High memory usage may indicate memory leaks or inefficient code that needs optimization. Monitor for trends over time.
panels.title: Memory Usage per Request

panels.description: Detailed view of individual PHP-FPM processes showing their current state (Idle/Running) and process ID. Useful for debugging specific process issues and understanding process distribution.
panels.title: Process Details

panels.description: OPcache hit ratio percentage. Values above 95% indicate good cache performance. Low hit rates suggest frequent code changes or insufficient cache size.
panels.title: OPcache Hit Ratio

panels.description: Memory utilization percentage of OPcache. High usage (>85%) may indicate need for more memory allocation or cache optimization.
panels.title: OPcache Memory Usage

panels.description: Number of cached scripts vs maximum capacity. Shows how close you are to the script limit.
panels.title: Script Cache Usage

panels.description: OPcache status indicators. Shows if cache is enabled, full, or if restarts are pending.
panels.title: OPcache Status

panels.description: Rate of cache hits and misses over time. Consistent high hit rates indicate good cache performance.
panels.title: Cache Hit/Miss Rate

panels.description: Memory usage breakdown showing used, free, and wasted memory in the OPcache.
panels.title: Memory Usage Breakdown

panels.description: Interned strings memory usage and count. Shows efficiency of string deduplication in PHP.
panels.title: Interned Strings

panels.description: JIT compilation status and buffer usage. Shows if JIT is enabled and how much buffer is being used.
panels.title: JIT Status

panels.description: OPcache restart counters showing different types of cache restarts over time.
panels.title: Cache Restarts
